title: Liverpool star Sadio Mane in defiant response to awards snub
text:

Liverpool ace Sadio Mane defiantly refused to be downbeat after being snubbed for major awards this year - insisting he must "work harder".

Mane won Lionel Messi's vote for the FIFA Men's Player of the Year award, and has been tipped as a contender for this year's Ballon d'Or.

However, he has so far failed to win any awards after an outstanding 2018/19 season - and didn't even make the FIFA FIFPro Men's World11.

Mane finished last season as a Champions League winner - having played a crucial role in Liverpool's triumph - and as joint top scorer in the Premier League as the Reds missed out on the title by a single point.

He also helped fire Senegal to the Africa Cup of Nations final.

(Image: Action Images via Reuters)

And he has started this season in similar style, with eight goals to his name already this campaign as Liverpool sit eight points clear at the top of the Premier League with a 100% record.

And yet, Mane could only finish fifth in the UEFA Men's Player of the Year award and didn't make the top three for The Best FIFA Men's Player gong - despite the backing of Messi.

And the likes of Kylian Mbappe and Eden Hazard beat him to places in the Men's World11, despite arguably not having such strong seasons as the Senegal forward.

But Mane is taking it on the chin - and vowed to become an even better player.

(Image: AFP via Getty Images)

"As I said before, I do not focus on individual distinctions, the collective results are more important to me," said the Liverpool forward to Canal+ Sport, quoted by RMC Sport .

"The choices were made. I wasn't chosen, the players in the awards had exceptional seasons, they deserved to be there, I congratulate these players.

"I think it's a strong message for me to work harder.

"I accept, it's hard for me to to say that I deserve to be there, I'm modest enough for that, and the thing is, the choices have been made and I respect them."

(Image: Getty Images)

As humble as he is, though, Mane believes he deserved to be in the Men's World11.

It's a jury that votes and everyone has their way of seeing things," he added.

"Personally, I would say that I deserve to be there but it's a choice.

"Others say they prefer Virgil van Dijk, or they prefer Eden Hazard - you just have to congratulate these guys."
description: Mane was backed by Messi for FIFA gong after an outstanding season, but has so far left empty-handed from awards ceremonies
